channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kroger's longtime CEO resigns abruptly after investigation
item.description: The country's largest grocery chain cited an investigation into conduct "unrelated to the business" but inconsistent with its code of ethics. Rodney M...

item.title: The turning tide of U.S. support for Ukraine
item.description: As the war in Ukraine approached its third anniversary last month, the tide began to turn — not on the battlefield, but in the White House.

item.title: Trump to announce Taiwanese firm's $100 billion investment in U.S. chip plants
item.description: The anticipated announcement comes amid President Trump's threats to impose tariffs over semiconductor chip imports.

item.title: Man pleads guilty to murder and attempted murder in shooting at suburban Chicago July 4 parade
item.description: An Illinois man pleaded guilty Monday to killing seven people and injuring dozens more when he opened fire on a 2022 Independence Day parade in a Chic...

item.title: Blatter and Platini back in court in Swiss Fifa fraud case
item.description: Ex-Fifa head Sepp Blatter and French football great Michel Platini were cleared in 2022, but prosecutors appealed.

item.title: US tariffs on Canada and Mexico will go ahead on Tuesday, says commerce chief
item.description: Howard Lutnick says the president's threat of blanket import taxes on his neighbours will proceed as planned.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire in peril as Israel and Hamas hit impasse
item.description: Concern grows after Israel said it would block aid to Gaza unless Hamas accepted a new US proposal.

item.title: What hurdles does Europe's peace plan for Ukraine face?
item.description: Whatever words are used to frame the plan, enormous challenges lie ahead, the BBC's Frank Gardner writes.

item.title: Pope Francis suffers "acute respiratory failure" episodes, Vatican says
item.description: Pope Francis suffered two episodes of "acute respiratory failure" and had a pair of bronchoscopies to relieve his respiratory distress, the Vatican sa...

item.title: Crews battle wildfires in North and South Carolina amid dry conditions and gusty winds

item.title: Pope Francis has 2 episodes of "acute respiratory failure," Vatican says

item.title: The turning tide of U.S. support for Ukraine
item.description: As the war in Ukraine approached its third anniversary last month, the tide began to turn — not on the battlefield, but in the White House.

item.title: The political power of the pope

item.title: Nigerian Muslims arrested for eating in public during Ramadan
item.description: A total of 25 people are arrested for either not fasting or selling food during the fasting month.

item.title: After an Alzheimer's diagnosis, a new job gave a father 'dignity' and 'purpose'
item.description: When Paul Cotter's father began to show signs of early-onset Alzheimer's disease, he lost job after job. Then a small local company offered him a role...

item.title: New deputy FBI director Dan Bongino previously called for imprisoning Democrats
